Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Display package page semver 2 redirect does not work as expected" (#7817) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
The display package page redirects if the version provided in the URI is not normalized. For example using version [`05.5.0-preview1.6319`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Packaging/05.5.0-preview.1.6319) will get redirected to [`5.5.0-preview1.6319`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Packaging/5.5.0-preview.1.6319). However, semver 2 version [`5.5.0-preview.1.6319+ba2a72ac9afd9e7260798a6ad14088297570b350`](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Packaging/5.5.0-preview.1.6319+ba2a72ac9afd9e7260798a6ad14088297570b350) does not redirect as expected.

### Expected behavior
Navigating to a semver2 version should redirect to the normalized version.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ID Prefix Reservation" (#7816) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I have twice now followed the instructions for reserving an ID prefix to a name that matches the prefix of all 14 of my packages. It is also a name that I hold a federal trademark on. The second time, I also sent an email to an address I had for NuGet saying that it was my second attempt and that I had heard nothing back from the first attempt.

In both cases, I never heard anything back and my ID prefix is still not reserved.

Is this a process that for some reason is normal to take several months? Or is it possible that the request was silently rejected for some reason? What should be my expectations for sending such an email into the void?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ID Prefix Reservation" (#7816) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I have twice now followed the instructions for reserving an ID prefix to a name that matches the prefix of all 14 of my packages. It is also a name that I hold a federal trademark on. In both cases, I never heard anything back and my ID prefix is still not reserved.

Is this a process that for some reason is normal to take several months? Or is it possible that the request was silently rejected for some reason? What should be my expectations for sending such an email into the void?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Search Results Display Order" (#7815) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I know this has been discussed before as I've found old, closed issues about it. But I don't see anything recent.

Is there any logic used in the order of search results?

I know this is a tricky issue as I assume many people would try and game the system to display their packages at the top. But is there any rules used at all?

As a second point, I have several packages that I really believe people will want if they know about it. Has NuGet ever considered supported any path developers can use to somehow promote their packages. I got a nice boost when first posted. I assume it was listed somewhere. But now people don't know to find it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "'Manage NuGet Packages for Solution' should provide UI to limit versions for packages" (#9082) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/idea/801970/manage-nuget-packages-for-solution-should-provide.html)._

---
If I want to ensure that my Visual Studio solution does not update a package beyond a certain version, I can manually edit the packages.config file, but there should be a UI in 'Manage NuGet Packages for Solution' for this task.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/concepts/package-versioning#semantic-versioning-200

My common scenario is that I want to ensure that I get all of the latest updates for Umbraco and related packages, but I do not want to be offered any that require me to upgrade Umbraco from version 7 to version 8.

If I do not manually edit the packages.config with:
`allowedVersion=(,8.0)`
... I get a lot of "noise" in the UI for package updates I would not want.

---
### Original Comments

#### Visual Studio Feedback System on 11/1/2019, 00:21 AM: 

Thank you for taking the time to provide your suggestion. We will do some preliminary checks to make sure we can proceed further.  We'll provide an update once the issue has been triaged by the product team.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Deprecation info is not visible, by default, on installed tab" (#8541) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Feature: Deprecation

The idea of the feature on VS was to show the deprecation info as warning ⚠️ on the INSTALLED tab. Clicking on this tab leads to the packages listed and are deprecated using the warning ⚠️ icon on package’s installed version. Clicking on this reveals the warning ⚠️ icon and deprecation info on the details pane. Essentially the warning ⚠️ icons leads to the issue details.

This doesn’t happen today because the installed tab shows the package details of the latest version by default and not if the one that’s installed.

Proposed fix, reviewed by UX:
* There is no need to show both the installed  version and the latest version on the installed tab. We can show just the one installed:

Version: \<Installed version in the drop down> UnistallButton

Will update the proposed UX soon.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "select/filter projects in nuget solution that already have the nuget installed or have same version" (#9081) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/892124/selectfilter-projects-in-nuget-solution-that-alrea.html)._

---
For big solutions with a lot of projects, it is a manual and tedious process to select each individual project that has a dependency on the nuget.

Example layout:

[ ] Project    Version

[x] Project1    3.0.1
[x] Project2    3.0.1
 [ ] Project3
[x] Project4    3.0.1
 [ ] Project5
[x] Project6    3.0.1
 [ ] Project7
[x] Project8    3.0.1
[x] Project9    3.0.1

Now in this layout, these are the only options I found::
- press the top left for select All/Select None
- sort by Version (which puts all the projects that have it installed together, but u still have to manually check or uncheck each one)

This becomes very tedious for big solutions (in my case 80+ projects) and only a fraction of them depend on this nuget, and only the projects that depend on it need to be updated. This requires manually checking each of these projects (or select All and unchecking, based on the fraction value), and then clicking "install" button to update them

Feature request:
- [minimum]
       - a button or an easy way to select only the projects that have the nuget installed
- [complete (recommended)]
       - select all the projects with a given version. Maybe some sort of filter by version?

---
### Original Comments

#### Visual Studio Feedback System on 1/21/2020, 03:02 PM: 

We have converted this feedback item from idea to problem. This change was done to better reflect the feedback's nature.

---
### Original Solutions
(no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Narrator is reading "1 of 1" for "browse","install","update" tabs" (#9079) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Publish/Build/Debug resolves to an old DLL resulting in MissingMethodException" (#9080) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/748792/publishbuilddebug-resolves-to-an-old-dll-resulting.html)._ --- [regression] [worked-in:16.2.5] We have a web application running on .NET Framework 4.6.1 (let's call this project `A`) that has a dependent NuGet package (let's call this `B`). B targets multiple frameworks and includes `C` as a private dependency. `C.dll` is not versioned at the nuget nor assembly level. Here is what `B.csproj` looks like: ```xml netstandard2.0;net461;netcoreapp2.2 $(TargetsForTfmSpecificBuildOutput);IncludeP2PAssets ``` In the web application project (`A`) we installed `B` using the newer `PackageReference` format even though it's in an older csproj format: ```xml PackageReference true win ``` On Visual Studio 16.2.5, all references seem to be resolved correctly (proven by decompiler). The .NET Standard version of `C.dll` is published at runtime. On Visual Studio 16.3.0, however, the .NET Framework 4.6.1 version of `C.dll` is published at runtime and it is of a very old version, leading to `MissingMethodException`. The strange thing is this doesn't have any compile-time errors, only runtime errors. Can you please fix this behavior change from 16.2.5 to 16.3.0? --- ### Original Comments #### Visual Studio Feedback System on 9/26/2019, 00:30 AM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

#### Visual Studio Feedback System on 9/26/2019, 10:49 PM:

Thank you for sharing your feedback! Our teams prioritize action on product issues with broad customer impact. See details at: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/ide/report-a-problem?view=vs-2017#faq. In case you need answers to common questions or need assisted support, be sure to use https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/vs/support/. We’ll keep you posted on any updates to this feedback.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "Embedded Icons in VS could leave open PackageArchiveReader objects" (#9069) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: VS UI

NuGet version: 39963d7775d6ba22e2e5c1373a7cb027ce9bdaa7

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

0. Specify a NuGet source with a local folder. The packages must have embedded icons. Add it to nuget.config ($APPDATA\NuGet\NuGet.Config)
1. Open VS, with any project and open NuGet (Manage NuGet packages...)
2. Leave it open for 20 minutes
3. Scroll the package list up an down

There's a possibility that the icons disappear because the PackageArchiveReader (PAR) are closed and, because the PAR instances are lazy loaded and memoized, those are not created anymore.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Signing: Set up development/project management plan and epics" (#8998) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This is a very large project, and we need to spend some time just managing the tasks that need done and aim our cannons towards releases at the priorities we need them.

The following sub-epics to #7939 should be created, each representing an individual deliverable, and will be done in order:

### Signature verification during restore
This is where the bulk of verification tests will be ported, and is simply a matter of enabling this functionality and making sure all associated tests pass. For any tests that currently require signing functionality, we should mark those particular test-fixing issues as blocked on a signing issue, and go ahead and fix/enable the signing tests related to that functionality as necessary. Try to minimize how much signing work we do in the process.

### Implement `dotnet verify`
Hot on the tail of signature verification will be the `dotnet verify` command, which should be released pretty soon after overall verification ships. As part of this task, we should do design work on **both** `dotnet verify` and `dotnet sign` to make sure the commands have a good, complementary UX, even though we won't be shipping `dotnet sign` yet.

### Implement `dotnet sign`
This is the final, big epic that will involve re-enabling all the signing tests and making sure they all pass. Again, the tests should stop relying on calling verification code and should simply be checks against static, pre-generated signed data.

From Azure Pipeline restore package succeed, but the content (css,js ,img) of package is not added in Web application .net

Agent.Version | 2.144.2

2. Restore Nuget package 
3. Build Solution: Faild, because it can't copy content (css,js,jpg,png) of package installed  in project web app C# VS 2019
